qas.question: What percentage of New Yorkers are Christians?
What percentage of New Yorkers follow the Catholic faith?
About how many Jews live in New York City?
What borough has the largest population of Jewish people?
What is the third most popular faith in New York City?
What was the most prominent religion in New York as of 2014?
The second most prominent religion in New York is what?
Half the population of Jews live in what borough of New York City?
What percentage of people in 2014 had no religion?
The third most popular religion in NYC is what?

context: <a5_0>Christianity<a5_0/> (<a0_0>59%<a0_0/>), particularly Catholicism (<a1_0>33%<a1_0/>), was the most prevalently practiced religion in New York as of 2014, followed by <a6_0>Judaism<a6_0/>, with approximately <a2_0>1.1 million<a2_0/> Jews in New York City, over half living in <a3_0><a7_0>Brooklyn<a7_0/><a3_0/>. <a4_0><a9_0>Islam<a9_0/><a4_0/> ranks third in New York City, with official estimates ranging between 600,000 and 1,000,000 observers and including 10% of the city's public schoolchildren, followed by Hinduism, Buddhism, and a variety of other religions, as well as atheism. In 2014, <a8_0>24<a8_0/>% self-identified with no organized religious affiliation.
